materials_name: gelatin  paper (fibre product)  silver sulfide  baryta paper
object_work_type: black-and-white prints (photographs) gelatin silver prints  photographic prints
physical_appearance: This print depicts a group of five men reeling in a fishing net on a sandy seashore. The print shows signs of discolouration as yellow hues can be seen in patches and along the edges of the print. The backing on which it is mounted on has yellow-brown spots as well.  In the bottom right corner, there is an RPS Associate 1957 symbol embossed. On the verso, there is the artist's photography studio chop, the number, and title of the work.
sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.
techniques_name: gelatin silver process photographic printing techniques black-and-white photography
